title: What do you think about this nautilus top build?

replies.body:
I main Nautilus support and I always buy anything with an active.
 Early game he can be kited easily, so I'd go for {{item:3009}} instead. Protobelt is good for landing your autos if you don't have your Q so I'd get that early if I want to go for damage. Also, the way I play, the plan is to stay on the enemy, so I grab {{item:3100}} for the speed and mana and a {{item:3116}}  to CC the enemy to death. 

The build looks like it works, though with my experience, the enemy I target are ranged squishies and they run away, so I don't know how the Rageblade will do. With Nautilus being slow, the Sunfire Cape is good for doing damage or at least negating health regen with just your presence.

i love nashor's on naut, but it just doesn't do him justice. maybe nashor's rageblade would be a silly build to toy with, but even then i think due to his really low base aspd it might not be the best idea because it doesn't scale very well as a multiplier
why rageblade? Wouldn't Abysall or RoA be better?

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wgwiGWXW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-14T02:04:13.039+0000)
>
> why rageblade? Wouldn't Abysall or RoA be better?

is there anything more terrifying than a rapidly swinging anchor?

to give a real answer, it stacks AP per on hit along with a really nice flat amount of AP, it gives you an incentive to AA as many targets as possible to proc your passive (which you should do anyway, but this makes it so you can do so faster, increasing the rate of stuns you can lay down during a fight, the earlier you get it on cd the earlier you can reproc it). since you're in the front lines usually whaling away on people, it only makes sense to have the ability to do more damage as the fight goes on. RoA takes time to build up, not only that, but the hp/mana is negligible late game because if you're getting focused it isn't gonna help as much as just stacking on another tank item. honestly IBG gives you enough mana, and if you wanted to be tankier, you should just build tank. abyssal gives increased magic damage, but since you have relatively little AP, you would be getting it more to help the AP carries on your team, which could be good, but it doesn't doesn't help your own damage output all that much.

also as a side note, using Q puts you in the perfect distance to a target to shotgun them with protobelt.
